setVariants.name: Reverse Holo
setVariants.description: The reverse holo print of the set.

setVariants.name: Unlimited
setVariants.description: The unlimited print of the set.

cards.name: Alakazam

abilities.name: Damage Swap
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another as long as you don't Knock Out that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Alakazam is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5000.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Articuno
cards.text: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

attacks.name: Freeze Dry
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

variants.name: Lava Theme Deck Exclusive
variants.description: Non Holo Lava Theme Deck Exclusive

cards.name: Charizard

abilities.name: Energy Burn
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all Energy attached to Charizard into Fire Energy for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to unintentionally cause forest fires.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard or this attack does nothing.

variants.name: Turmoil Theme Deck Exclusive
variants.description: Non Holo Turmoil Theme Deck Exclusive

cards.name: Dark Blastoise
cards.text: An aggressive Pokémon that tackles anything it sees.

attacks.name: Hydrocannon
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Dark Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Rocket Tackle
attacks.text: Dark Blastoise does 10 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Dark Blastoise during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

cards.name: Dark Dragonite

abilities.name: Summon Minions
abilities.text: When you play Dark Dragonite from your hand, search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.text: Sometimes called "The God of Destruction." Its wings are able to support it in spite of its massive weight.

attacks.name: Giant Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Dark Persian
cards.text: Popular with women because of its beautiful fur. The leader of the Rockets keeps one as a pet.

attacks.name: Fascinate
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. This attack can't be used if your opponent has no Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

variants.name: Turmoil Theme Deck Exclusive
variants.description: Non Holo Turmoil Theme Deck Exclusive

cards.name: Dark Raichu
cards.text: Stores up electricity in its body, then suddenly releases it to surprise and shock everyone.

attacks.name: Surprise Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, flip another coin. If the second coins is heads, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If the second coin is tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Dark Slowbro

abilities.name: Reel In
abilities.text: When you play Dark Slowbro from your hand, choose up to 3 Basic Pokémon and/or Evolution cards from your discard pile and put them into your hand.

cards.text: It loves nothing better than to be left alone, and so sometimes ends up being manipulated by unscrupulous people.

attacks.name: Fickle Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Dark Vaporeon
cards.text: A Pokémon capable of controlling water, so it is capable of creating giant whirlpools.

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

cards.name: Flareon
cards.text: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Flareon or this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Gengar

abilities.name: Curse
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokémon). This power can't be used if Gengar is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Under a full moon, this Pokémon like to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Gyarados
cards.text: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Hitmonlee
cards.text: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Jolteon
cards.text: It accumulates negative ions from the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Pin Missle
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Machamp

abilities.name: Strikes Back
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's attack damages Machamp (even if Machamp is Knocked Out), this power does 10 damage to the attacking Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) This power can't be used if Machamp is already affected by a Special Condition when your opponent attacks.

cards.text: Using its amazing muscles, it throws powerful punches that can knock its victim clear over the horizon.

cards.name: Muk

abilities.name: Toxic Gas
abilities.text: Ignore all Pokémon Powers other than Toxic Gases. This power stops working while Muk is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

attacks.name: Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Ninetales
cards.text: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Ninetales or this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Venusaur

abilities.name: Energy Trans
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to a different one. This power can't be used if Venusaur is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: This plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

cards.name: Zapdos
cards.text: A legendary bird Pokémon said to appear from clouds while wielding enormous lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Zapdos or this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Beedrill
cards.text: Flies at high speed and attacks using the large, venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Butterfree
cards.text: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Butterfree equal of half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Butterfree has fewer damage counters that that, remove all of them.

cards.name: Electrode
cards.text: It stores electrical energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

attacks.name: Chain Lightning
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon isn't Colorless, this attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon of the same type as the Defending Pokémon (including your own). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Exeggutor
cards.text: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch Exeggutor with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Golem
cards.text: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Golem does 100 damage to itself.

cards.name: Hypno
cards.text: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

attacks.name: Prophecy
attacks.text: Look at up to 3 cards from the top of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Jynx
cards.text: Merely by meditating, the Pokémon launches a powerful psychic energy attack.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Kabutops
cards.text: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Kabutops equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Kabutops has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

cards.name: Magneton
cards.text: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 100 damage to itself.

cards.name: Mewtwo
cards.text: A scientist created this Pokémon after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

attacks.name: Energy Control
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and attach it to another of your opponent's Pokémon of your choice.

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

cards.name: Moltres
cards.text: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

attacks.name: Wildfire
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Moltres when you use this attack. If you do, discard that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Dive Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Nidoking
cards.text: Uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break its prey's bones.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage and Nidoking does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

cards.name: Nidoqueen
cards.text: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.

attacks.name: Boyfriends
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Nidoking you have in play.

cards.name: Pidgeot
cards.text: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

attacks.name: Hurricane
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, return the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Pidgeotto
cards.text: Very protective of its sprawling territory, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Pidgeotto was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Pidgeotto to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Rhydon
cards.text: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3600 degrees.

attacks.name: Ram
attacks.text: Rhydon does 20 damage to itself. Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon. Switch the Pokémon even if Rhydon is Knocked Out.)

cards.name: Arcanine
cards.text: A Pokémon that has been long admired for its beauty. It runs gracefully, as if on wings.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Arcanine or this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Arcanine does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Charmeleon
cards.text: When it swings its burning tail, it raises the temperature to unbearably high levels.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmeleon or this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Dark Dragonair

abilities.name: Evolutionary Light
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for an Evolution card. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Dark Dragonair is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: As is fitting for a legendary Pokémon, it has many strange powers, including the ability to make rain or snow fall.

attacks.name: Tail Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

cards.name: Dark Wartortle
cards.text: A Pokémon with a negative attitude, it hides in its shell whenever it's in a bad mood—which is often.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Mirror Shell
attacks.text: If an attack does damage to Dark Wartortle during your opponent's next turn (even if Dark Wartortle is Knocked Out), Dark Wartortle does an equal amount of damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Dewgong
cards.text: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Dodrio

abilities.name: Retreat Aid
abilities.text: As long as Dodrio is Benched, pay Colorless less to retreat your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Dodrio.

cards.name: Fearow
cards.text: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Fearow.

cards.name: Golduck
cards.text: Often seen swimming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

cards.name: Graveler
cards.text: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Graveler (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

cards.name: Growlithe
cards.text: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

cards.name: Haunter

abilities.name: Transparency
abilities.text: Whenever an attack does anything to Haunter, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Haunter. This power stops working while Haunter is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Ivysaur
cards.text: When the bulb on its back grows large, the Pokémon seems to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Kabuto

abilities.name: Kabuto Armor
abilities.text: Whenever an attack (even your own) does damage to Kabuto (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does only half the damage to Kabuto (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Kabuto is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.

cards.name: Kadabra
cards.text: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches even to those just nearby.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Kadabra or this attack does nothing. Remove all damage counters from Kadabra.

cards.name: Kakuna
cards.text: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Kakuna during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Machoke
cards.text: Its muscular body is so powerful that it must wear a power-save belt to help regulate its motions.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 50 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machoke.

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.text: Machoke does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Magikarp
cards.text: In the distant past, it was stronger than its horribly weak descendants that exist today.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Magikarp.

cards.name: Meowth
cards.text: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

cards.name: Metapod
cards.text: It is vulnerable to attack because its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Metapod during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Nidorina
cards.text: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Nidorino
cards.text: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Omanyte

abilities.name: Clairvoyance
abilities.text: Your opponent plays with his or her hand face up. This power stops working while Omanyte is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omanyte but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

cards.name: Omastar
cards.text: A prehistoric Pokémon that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible for it to catch prey.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omastar but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Primeape
cards.text: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until its quarry is caught.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Tantrum
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Primeape is now Confused (after doing damage).

cards.name: Rapidash
cards.text: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hope of racing it.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Rapidash.

cards.name: Raticate
cards.text: It uses its whiskers to maintain its balance. It seems to slow down if they are cut off.

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.text: Does damage to the Defending Pokémon equal to half the Defending Pokémon's remaining HP (rounded up to the nearest 10).

cards.name: Sandslash
cards.text: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Seadra
cards.text: Capable of swimming backward by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Seadra but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Seadra.

cards.name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Thick Skinned
abilities.text: Snorlax can't become Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, Poisoned, or Burned. This power stops working while Snorlax is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Tauros
cards.text: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Rampage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Tauros. Flip a coin. If tails, Tauros is now Confused (after doing damage).

cards.name: Tentacruel
cards.text: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, the are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Abra
cards.text: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and teleport to safety.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Bulbasaur
cards.text: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. Thus, a plant sprouted and now grows with this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Bulbasaur.

cards.name: Caterpie
cards.text: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Charmander
cards.text: Obviously prefers hot places. If it gets caught in the rain, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmander or this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Doduo
cards.text: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Dratini
cards.text: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.

cards.name: Drowzee

abilities.name: Long-Distance Hypnosis
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep; if tails, your Active Pokémon is now Asleep. The power can't be used if Drowzee is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Not popular with girls because of its attitude. Can often be heard muttering to itself in a low voice.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Eevee
cards.text: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from elemental stones.

attacks.name: Tail Wag
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Eevee during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

cards.name: Exeggcute
cards.text: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Exeggcute.

cards.name: Gastly
cards.text: A mysterious Pokémon. Some say it is a lifeform from another dimension, while others believe it is formed from smog.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Energy Conversion
attacks.text: Put up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand. Gastly does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Geodude
cards.text: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

attacks.name: Stone Barrage
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Grimer
cards.text: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

attacks.name: Nasty Goo
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Minimized
attacks.text: All damage done by attacks to Grimer during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Machop
cards.text: It's said that not even pro wrestlers can take down a Machop.

cards.name: Magnemite
cards.text: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses attacks like Thunder Wave.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magnemite does 40 damage to itself.

cards.name: Mankey
cards.text: Normally friendly, it quickly becomes angry if it doesn't get what it wants.

attacks.name: Mischief
attacks.text: Shuffle your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Anger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

cards.name: Nidoran ♀
cards.text: Although small, its venomous barbs make this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Nidoran ♀ or Nidoran ♂ and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

cards.name: Nidoran ♂
cards.text: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger, more powerful of its horns secretes venom.

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Onix
cards.text: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, though colored black.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Onix (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

cards.name: Pidgey
cards.text: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

cards.name: Pikachu
cards.text: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity can build and cause lightning storms.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Ponyta
cards.text: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything flat in moments.

cards.name: Psyduck
cards.text: It is often seen holding its head in its paws, as if it were suffering from a headache.

attacks.name: Dizziness
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Psyduck but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

cards.name: Rattata
cards.text: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

cards.name: Rhyhorn
cards.text: Its massive bones are 1,000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

cards.name: Sandshrew
cards.text: Burrow deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.

attacks.name: Sand-attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Seel
cards.text: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. This horn is used for bashing through thick ice.

cards.name: Slowpoke
cards.text: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

attacks.name: Spacing Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove a damage counter from Slowpoke. This attack can't be used if Slowpoke has no damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Scavenge
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Slowpoke in order to use this attack. Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.name: Spearow
cards.text: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Spearow was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Spearow to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Squirtle
cards.text: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. It powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Squirtle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

cards.name: Tentacool

abilities.name: Cowardice
abilities.text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may return Tentacool to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to Tentacool.) This power can't be used the turn you put Tentacool into play or if Tentacool is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

cards.name: Voltorb
cards.text: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

cards.name: Vulpix
cards.text: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. Its tail splits from the tip as it grows older.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Weedle
cards.text: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp, venomous stinger on its head.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Full Heal Energy
cards.text: If you play this card from your hand, the Pokémon you attach it to is no longer affected by a Special Condition. Full Heal Energy provides Colorless energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

cards.name: Potion Energy
cards.text: If you play this card from your hand, remove 1 damage counter from the Pokémon you attach it to, if it has any. Potion Energy provides Colorless energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

cards.name: Pokémon Breeder
cards.text: Put a Stage 2 Evolution card from your hand on the matching Basic Pokémon. You can play this card only when you would be allowed to evolve that Pokémon anyway.

cards.name: Pokémon Trader
cards.text: Trade 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards in your hand for 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from your deck. Show both cards to your opponent. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Scoop Up
cards.text: Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play and return its Basic Pokémon card to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that card.)

cards.name: The Boss's Way
cards.text: Search your deck for an Evolution card with Dark in its name. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Challenge!
cards.text: Ask your opponent if he or she accepts your challenge. If your opponent declines (or if both Benches are full), draw 2 cards. If your opponent accepts, each of you searches your decks for any number of Basic Pokémon cards and puts them face down onto your Benches. (A player can't do this if his or her Bench is full.) When you both have finished, shuffle your decks and turn those cards face up.

cards.name: Energy Retrieval
cards.text: Trade 1 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile.

cards.name: Bill
cards.text: Draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Mysterious Fossil
cards.text: Play Mysterious Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Mysterious Fossil counts as a Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Mysterious Fossil has no attacks, can't retreat, and can't be affected by Special Conditions. If Mysterious Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Mysterious Fossil from play. You can put Pokémon that evolve from Mysterious Fossil on this card.

cards.name: Potion
cards.text: Remove up to 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.
